elements.title: Qalaherriaq (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that teenage Inuk interpreter Qalaherriaq (pictured) drew an accurate map of northwest Greenland while using a pencil for the first time?

elements.title: 60,000 Chinese citizens migrated to the Soviet Union (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that from March to May 1962, 60,000 Chinese citizens migrated to the Soviet Union through two ports of entry?

elements.title: Paul Pavelka (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that aviator Paul Pavelka was killed after being thrown and stampeded by a horse?

elements.title: Laguna Honda Hospital (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Laguna Honda Hospital is a non-profit long-term care facility that has been described as America's "last big almshouse"?

elements.title: Yunè Pinku (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Yunè Pinku derived the first half of her stage name from the Japanese word for 'cloudy' and the second half from the children's program Pingu?

elements.title: a college designed for and led by Native Americans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a college designed for and led by Native Americans was active in Chicago from 1974 to 2005?

elements.title: John Boswell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Boswell believed that the executed King Charles I of England was a martyr?

elements.title: zanana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that zanana can refer to a nagging wife in Egypt, or to Israeli drones flying overhead in Gaza?
